title: Frontend Developer
description: Join OpenAI’s frontend team to craft seamless, accessible, and performant user interfaces using modern frameworks. You’ll work closely with product managers, designers, and researchers to ship features that enhance user experience and scale across web platforms. Expect to participate in code reviews, maintain design consistency, and improve developer tooling as part of a fast-moving agile environment.
requirements: 3+ years of experience building scalable web applications
Expertise in React, TypeScript, and modern ES6+ JavaScript
Strong understanding of web performance, accessibility (a11y), and security best practices
Experience with testing frameworks like Jest, React Testing Library, or Cypress
Ability to translate product/design specs into robust interfaces
Strong communication and cross-functional collaboration skills

title: UI Engineer
description: As a UI Engineer at Figma, you'll bridge the gap between design and engineering. You'll own the development of polished, high-performance UI components that feel intuitive and delightful. You’ll collaborate with product designers and platform engineers to ensure seamless integration of design systems and support accessibility at scale.
requirements: Advanced CSS/SASS skills and deep understanding of layout techniques (Grid, Flexbox)
Proven experience building and maintaining design systems
Understanding of WCAG and ARIA for inclusive design
Proficiency in modern JavaScript and modular architecture
Excellent attention to detail and a passion for clean UI

title: Junior Frontend Intern
description: Start your frontend journey with Heabron by working alongside experienced developers on real-world projects. You’ll learn how to structure scalable web components, participate in code reviews, and understand agile workflows. This internship provides a mentorship-driven environment focused on growth, technical fundamentals, and best practices.
requirements: Basic understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript fundamentals
Willingness to learn modern frontend frameworks like React
Strong communication and eagerness to collaborate in a team
Attention to detail and problem-solving mindset
Familiarity with version control tools like Git (a plus)

title: React Native Developer
description: Spotify is looking for a React Native Developer to craft high-quality, cross-platform mobile applications. You'll be responsible for implementing smooth animations, optimizing performance across devices, and ensuring a native-like user experience. Collaborate with backend engineers and designers in a fast-paced environment.
requirements: Proficiency with React Native and Expo
Experience creating performant mobile UIs and animations
Familiarity with state management (e.g., Redux, Zustand)
Knowledge of mobile-specific debugging and profiling tools
Strong grasp of cross-platform differences and native module bridging

title: Web Developer
description: As a Freelance Web Developer, you'll work with small businesses to design, build, and maintain professional websites. You'll independently manage client communication, provide technical guidance, and ensure mobile-friendly, SEO-optimized sites using modern no-code/low-code tools or custom HTML/CSS/JS stacks.
requirements: Experience with WordPress, Wix, or Webflow
Strong client communication and requirement-gathering skills
Solid understanding of responsive design and basic SEO
Ability to meet deadlines and juggle multiple projects
Knowledge of page speed optimization and CMS management

title: Frontend Intern
description: Join Notion’s internship program to help build collaborative, beautiful interfaces. You'll get hands-on experience in React development, participate in design discussions, and learn to contribute clean code within a production-grade codebase.
requirements: Basic knowledge of React and JavaScript ES6+
Familiarity with Tailwind CSS or similar utility-first CSS frameworks
Understanding of component-driven development
Desire to learn and contribute to real projects
Strong collaboration and communication skills

title: Full Stack Developer
description: Join Netflix’s core video player team as a Full Stack Developer. You'll design and maintain features across the stack, ensuring smooth playback performance and improving scalability of backend services. You’ll work closely with QA, product, and engineering to build robust, testable code.
requirements: Strong experience with Node.js, Express, and React
Experience with MongoDB or similar NoSQL databases
Familiarity with cloud services like AWS or GCP
Understanding of video streaming and optimization principles
Proficient in writing unit and integration tests

title: Frontend Engineer
description: Work on building interactive UI components for Twitter’s social features. This role focuses on high-performance rendering, responsive design, and building user-facing features at scale in Next.js. You'll operate in an agile, experimental engineering environment.
requirements: Expertise in React and Next.js (SSR/ISR)
Experience with Lighthouse and performance audits
Strong grasp of frontend security (XSS, CSRF)
Familiarity with GraphQL and REST APIs
Ability to work asynchronously with distributed teams

title: Web Intern
description: Join a growing engineering team at Heabron and assist in developing lightweight pages, supporting CI/CD pipelines, and learning how professional codebases work. This is an ideal role for beginners aiming to build strong frontend foundations with mentorship and live project exposure.
requirements: Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and basic JavaScript
Basic Git knowledge (branching, commits)
Willingness to participate in code reviews and team calls
Attention to detail and eagerness to learn
Understanding of responsive design principles

title: Frontend Developer
description: Help build high-scale, customer-facing experiences on Amazon’s core web platform. As a frontend developer, you'll work on reusable UI components, improve loading speeds, and implement new features that impact millions of users globally.
requirements: Proficient in React, TypeScript, and Redux
Experience with scalable frontend architecture
Ability to write testable, modular code
Strong attention to performance metrics and optimization
Comfort working in CI/CD environments

title: Software Engineer
description: Be part of Microsoft Office's modern frontend experience team. You'll help build reusable components, fine-tune performance, and implement accessibility-compliant features used by millions worldwide.
requirements: Deep understanding of frontend performance techniques
Strong React and JavaScript (ES6+) skills
Experience with unit, snapshot, and E2E testing
Accessibility (ARIA, keyboard navigation, screen reader support)
Experience working in agile sprints with Git-based workflows

title: Frontend Intern
description: Contribute to Trello's product interface by shipping minor features and bug fixes. You’ll learn real-world frontend development using React and SCSS while collaborating on a widely used productivity tool.
requirements: Understanding of React components and state
Familiarity with SCSS or CSS preprocessors
Strong problem-solving attitude
Eagerness to learn from feedback and code reviews
Clear communication in a remote environment

title: UI/UX Designer & Developer
description: Take full ownership of designing and building a lightweight admin panel for a SaaS product. Collaborate with non-technical clients to translate business needs into clean, functional UIs, using Figma and React.
requirements: Proficiency in Figma and design hand-off tools
React development with styled-components or CSS Modules
Strong understanding of usability and UX flows
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Experience handling small-scale freelance projects

title: React Developer
description: Join Stripe to work on highly critical interfaces that power global payments. Build complex, maintainable React components integrated with GraphQL APIs in a production-grade environment.
requirements: Strong expertise in React and GraphQL
Experience building scalable UIs in a financial or SaaS context
Familiarity with testing libraries (e.g., RTL, Vitest)
Code optimization and refactoring skills
Excellent communication and documentation practices

title: Frontend Mentor
description: Provide hands-on feedback to learners submitting frontend challenges. Use your experience to help guide juniors on code structure, semantics, and best practices while fostering an inclusive and constructive learning environment.
requirements: Strong knowledge of React and modern frontend standards
Experience mentoring or teaching frontend concepts
Clear and concise written communication
Empathy and patience with beginners
Familiarity with HTML/CSS accessibility and semantics

title: Next.js Developer
description: Build and optimize production-grade applications on the Vercel platform. Implement static generation, serverless APIs, and progressive enhancement using Next.js. Collaborate with edge performance teams.
requirements: Deep understanding of Next.js (SSR, ISR, SSG)
Experience with serverless and edge computing
Strong frontend fundamentals (HTML/CSS/JS)
Excellent Git and collaboration habits
Performance testing and lighthouse audits

title: UI Prototyper
description: Rapidly prototype UI/UX concepts for internal product testing. Use React and animation libraries to simulate end-user experience and validate designs.
requirements: Expertise in prototyping tools and frameworks
Experience with Framer Motion or GSAP
Ability to convert design specs into functional prototypes
Quick iteration and versioning practices
Strong visual and interaction design sense

title: Frontend QA Intern
description: Assist the QA team in testing and validating frontend builds across different environments. Learn how to write UI test scripts, report bugs, and verify patch releases for Slack’s communication platform.
requirements: Interest in software quality assurance
Basic HTML/CSS/JS understanding
Familiarity with browser dev tools
Strong attention to UI/UX details
Good documentation habits

title: Frontend Systems Engineer
description: Work on frontend infrastructure systems supporting Google's suite of applications. Focus on component library development, build pipelines, and shared tooling.
requirements: 5+ years in large-scale frontend engineering
Experience with monorepos and build tools (e.g., Webpack, Turborepo)
Strong TypeScript and testing discipline
Background in performance and telemetry collection
Excellent systems thinking and documentation

title: Junior UI Developer
description: Work with Dribbble’s design team to implement pixel-perfect interfaces and design explorations. Ideal for junior developers transitioning from design to frontend code.
requirements: Strong understanding of HTML/CSS and Figma handoffs
Entry-level React and JavaScript experience
Pixel-perfect attention to detail
Basic Git version control skills
Ability to work from detailed mockups
